title: Under the sustainable sea(weeds): gimme Seaweed talks eco-friendly and organic snacks - FoodNavigator-USA.com
summary: The article discusses gimme Seaweed's sustainable and organic production process, focusing on its environmental benefits, flavor innovations, and distribution strategies.
green_innovation: TRUE This is green innovation as it emphasizes sustainable and organic production methods aimed at reducing environmental impacts.
business_innovation: TRUE This is business innovation as it highlights new product development and distribution strategies to meet consumer demands.
green_product: TRUE This is a green product as it is designed and manufactured in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its lifecycle.
green_process: TRUE This is a green process as it involves sustainable and environmentally friendly methods in the production of seaweed snacks.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 311999 - All Other Miscellaneous Food Manufacturing, 311421 - Fruit and Vegetable Canning, 311422 - Specialty Canning, 311919 - Other Snack Food Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE This is not an example of greenwashing as the article focuses on real and impactful environmental practices and benefits.

title: Wheat replacement: South Korea partners with local food brands to intensify rice flour NPD - FoodNavigator-Asia.com
summary: South Korea plans to use rice flour in place of wheat flour to address supply shortages and overproduction of rice in the country, with a national project involving major food and beverage firms to create new rice-based products.
green_innovation: TRUE. This initiative aligns with green innovation as it aims to reduce negative environmental externalities by promoting the use of rice flour in place of wheat flour, addressing supply shortages and overproduction of rice.
business_innovation: TRUE. The introduction of new rice-based products in collaboration with 15 major food and beverage companies represents a significant departure from previous offerings and is being brought into use by the firms, meeting the criteria for business innovation.
green_product: TRUE. The development of new rice-based food products designed to use environmentally friendly powdered rice as a substitute for wheat flour aligns with the definition of a green product by significantly reducing the environmental impact throughout the product life cycle.
green_process: FALSE. While the text discusses the use of powdered rice and its benefits, it does not delve into specific methods or techniques that minimize environmental impacts in the production processes, falling short of a definitive green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 311822 - Flour Mixes and Dough Manufacturing from Purchased Flour, 311824 - Dry Pasta Manufacturing, 311822 - Bread and Bakery Product Manufacturing, 311911 - Roasted Nuts and Peanut Butter Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE. The article text does not indicate any misleading or false information regarding the environmental benefits of the product innovation; thus, it does not align with the concept of greenwashing.
